privacy-policy.p1: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any information that can be used to identify you personally. For more detailed information on data protection, please refer to our Privacy Policy listed below this text.
privacy-policy.h4-1: Who is responsible for data collection on this website?
privacy-policy.p2: The data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. You can find their contact details in the section: 'Notice to the Responsible Party' in this privacy policy.
privacy-policy.h4-2: How do we collect your data?
privacy-policy.p3: Your data is collected, on the one hand, by you providing it to us. This may include, for example, data you enter into a contact form.
privacy-policy.p4: Other data is collected automatically or with your consent when you visit the website through our IT systems. This mainly includes technical data (e.g., internet browser, operating system, or time of page view). The collection of this data happens automatically as soon as you enter this website.
privacy-policy.h4-3: How do we use your data?
privacy-policy.p5: Some of the data is collected to ensure the error-free provision of the website. Other data may be used to analyze your user behavior.
privacy-policy.h4-4: What rights do you have regarding your data?
privacy-policy.p6: You have the right to obtain, free of charge, information about the origin, recipients, and purpose of your stored personal data at any time. You also have the right to request the correction or deletion of this data. If you have given consent to data processing, you can withdraw this consent at any time for the future. Furthermore, you have the right to request the restriction of processing your personal data under certain circumstances. Additionally, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.
privacy-policy.p7: For this purpose, as well as for any further questions regarding data protection, you can contact us at any time.
privacy-policy.p8: When you visit this website, your browsing behavior may be statistically analyzed. This is mainly done using so-called analytics programs.
privacy-policy.p9: Detailed information about these analytics programs can be found in the following privacy policy.
privacy-policy.p10: The operators of this site take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the legal data protection regulations as well as this privacy policy.
privacy-policy.p11: When you use this website, various personal data is collected. Personal data is information that can be used to identify you personally. This privacy policy explains which data we collect and how we use it. It also explains how and for what purpose this happens.
privacy-policy.p12: We would like to point out that data transmission over the internet (e.g., when communicating via email) may have security vulnerabilities. Complete protection of data from access by third parties is not possible.
privacy-policy.p13: The data controller for data processing on this website is:
privacy-policy.p14: The data controller is the natural or legal person who alone or jointly with others determines the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g., names, email addresses, etc.).
privacy-policy.p15: Unless a more specific storage duration is stated within this privacy policy, your personal data will remain with us until the purpose of data processing no longer applies. If you make a legitimate request for deletion or withdraw consent to data processing, your data will be deleted, unless we have other legally permissible reasons for storing your personal data (e.g., tax or commercial retention periods); in the latter case, deletion will occur after these reasons no longer apply.
privacy-policy.h3-7: General Information on the Legal Grounds for Data Processing on This Website
privacy-policy.p16: If you have consented to data processing, we process your personal data based on Article 6(1)(a) GDPR or Article 9(2)(a) GDPR, if special categories of data are processed according to Article 9(1) GDPR. In the case of explicit consent to the transfer of personal data to third countries, data processing is also carried out based on Article 49(1)(a) GDPR. If you have consented to the storage of cookies or access to information on your device (e.g., via device fingerprinting), data processing is additionally carried out based on Section 25(1) TTDSG. The consent can be revoked at any time. If your data is necessary for the performance of a contract or for the implementation of pre-contractual measures, we process your data based on Article 6(1)(b) GDPR. Furthermore, we process your data if it is required to fulfill a legal obligation based on Article 6(1)(c) GDPR. Data processing may also occur based on our legitimate interest under Article 6(1)(f) GDPR. The relevant legal grounds for each case are explained in the following sections of this privacy policy.
privacy-policy.p17: As part of our business activities, we work with various external parties. In some cases, it is necessary to transfer personal data to these external parties. We only share personal data with external parties if this is required for the performance of a contract, if we are legally obligated to do so (e.g., transferring data to tax authorities), if we have a legitimate interest under Article 6(1)(f) GDPR in sharing the data, or if another legal basis allows the data transfer. When using processors, we only share personal data of our customers based on a valid contract for data processing. In the case of joint processing, a joint processing agreement is made.
privacy-policy.h3-9: Withdrawal of your consent to data processing
privacy-policy.p18: Many data processing operations are only possible with your explicit consent. You can withdraw your consent at any time. The legality of the data processing carried out until the withdrawal remains unaffected by the withdrawal.
privacy-policy.h3-10: Right to object to data collection in special cases as well as to direct marketing (Article 21 GDPR)
privacy-policy.p19: IF DATA PROCESSING IS BASED ON ARTICLE 6(1)(E) OR (F) GDPR, YOU HAVE THE RIGHT TO OBJECT AT ANY TIME, ON GROUNDS RELATING TO YOUR PARTICULAR SITUATION, TO THE PROCESSING OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA; THIS ALSO APPLIES TO PROFILING BASED ON THESE PROVISIONS. THE RELEVANT LEGAL BASIS FOR THE PROCESSING IS PROVIDED IN THIS PRIVACY POLICY. IF YOU OBJECT, WE WILL NO LONGER PROCESS YOUR PERSONAL DATA, UNLESS WE CAN DEMONSTRATE COMPELLING LEGAL GROUNDS FOR THE PROCESSING THAT OVERRIDE YOUR INTERESTS, RIGHTS AND FREEDOMS, OR THE PROCESSING IS NECESSARY FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT, EXERCISE OR DEFENSE OF LEGAL CLAIMS (OBJECTION UNDER ARTICLE 21(1) GDPR).
privacy-policy.p20: IF YOUR PERSONAL DATA IS PROCESSED FOR DIRECT MARKETING PURPOSES, YOU HAVE THE RIGHT TO OBJECT AT ANY TIME TO THE PROCESSING OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUCH MARKETING; THIS ALSO APPLIES TO PROFILING, TO THE EXTENT THAT IT IS RELATED TO SUCH DIRECT MARKETING. IF YOU OBJECT, YOUR PERSONAL DATA WILL NO LONGER BE USED FOR DIRECT MARKETING PURPOSES (OBJECTION UNDER ARTICLE 21(2) GDPR).
privacy-policy.h3-11: Right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority
privacy-policy.p21: In the event of violations of the GDPR, the affected individuals have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, particularly in the member state of their habitual residence, their place of work, or the location of the alleged infringement. The right to complain exists without prejudice to any other administrative or judicial remedies.
privacy-policy.p22: You have the right to request that data we process automatically based on your consent or in fulfillment of a contract be provided to you or a third party in a common, machine-readable format. If you request the direct transfer of data to another controller, this will only be done to the extent that it is technically feasible.
privacy-policy.p23: You have the right, within the framework of applicable laws, to request free access to your stored personal data, including its origin, recipients, the purpose of data processing, and, if applicable, the right to correct or delete this data. You can contact us at any time for this and any further questions about personal data.
privacy-policy.p24: You have the right to request the restriction of processing of your personal data. You can contact us at any time. The right to restrict processing applies in the following cases:
privacy-policy.li1: If you dispute the accuracy of the personal data we have stored, we generally need time to verify this. During the verification period, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data.
privacy-policy.li2: If the processing of your personal data is unlawful, you can request the restriction of data processing instead of deletion.
privacy-policy.li3: If we no longer need your personal data, but you require it for the exercise, defense, or assertion of legal claims, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data instead of deletion.
privacy-policy.li4: If you have lodged an objection under Art. 21 (1) GDPR, a balance must be struck between your interests and ours. As long as it is not yet determined whose interests prevail, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data.
privacy-policy.p25: If you have restricted the processing of your personal data, these data may only be processed – apart from storage – with your consent or for the assertion, exercise, or defense of legal claims, or to protect the rights of another natural or legal person, or for reasons of important public interest of the European Union or a member state.
privacy-policy.p26: The use of contact details published within the framework of the legal notice to send unsolicited advertising and informational materials is hereby objected to. The website operators expressly reserve the right to take legal action in the case of unsolicited sending of advertising information, such as spam emails.
privacy-policy.p27: Our websites use so-called 'cookies'. Cookies are small data packages that do not cause any harm to your device. They are either temporarily stored for the duration of a session (session cookies) or stored permanently (persistent cookies) on your device. Session cookies are automatically deleted after your visit ends. Persistent cookies remain stored on your device until you delete them or they are automatically deleted by your web browser.
privacy-policy.p28: Cookies may come from us (first-party cookies) or third parties (third-party cookies). Third-party cookies enable the integration of certain services from third-party providers within the website (e.g., cookies for processing payment services).
privacy-policy.p29: Cookies serve various functions. Many cookies are technically necessary because certain website functions would not work without them (e.g., shopping cart functionality or displaying videos). Other cookies may be used to evaluate user behavior or for advertising purposes.
privacy-policy.p30: Cookies that are necessary for the execution of the electronic communication process, for providing certain features you have requested (e.g., for the shopping cart function), or for optimizing the website (e.g., cookies for measuring web audience) are stored based on Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. f DSGVO, unless another legal basis is specified. The website operator has a legitimate interest in storing necessary cookies for the technically error-free and optimized provision of their services. If consent for the storage of cookies and similar recognition technologies has been requested, processing is carried out solely based on this consent (Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. a DSGVO and § 25 Para. 1 TTDSG); consent can be revoked at any time.
privacy-policy.p31: You can configure your browser to be notified about the setting of cookies and only allow cookies on a case-by-case basis, exclude the acceptance of cookies for certain cases or generally, and activate automatic deletion of cookies when closing the browser. Deactivating cookies may restrict the functionality of this website.
privacy-policy.p32: You can find which cookies and services are used on this website in this privacy policy.
